alert.note: Alert for Osborne; Rooks (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 1:38PM CDT until July 14 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Kansas, including the following counties, Osborne and Rooks. * WHEN...Until 445 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 132 PM CDT, Emergency management reported that some county roads southwest of Plainville had some water affecting them due to earlier heavy rainfall of 1 to 3 inches. Minor flooding is already occurring. Fortunately, additional rainfall in the Advisory area this afternoon should average under one-half inch before rain ends for the day. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Eagle Creek, Lost Creek, Paradise Creek, Medicine Creek, Sand Creek, Elm Creek and Plainville Township Lake Area. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Plainville, Natoma, Zurich and Codell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
